snippet: The death total, the largest in a single day for the military of the United Arab Emirates, was a major setback for the coalition of Arab forces trying to vanquish the rebels.
abstract: United Arab Emirates announces that 45 of its soldiers were killed in clash with Houthi insurgents in Yemen, largest death toll in single day for its military; Bahrain also reports five soldiers were killed; casualties are seen as major setback for Saudi-led coalition fighting to restore Yemen's exiled government.
lead_paragraph: The death total, the largest in a single day for the military of the United Arab Emirates, was a major setback for the coalition of Arab forces trying to vanquish the rebels.

headline.main: Houthi Rebels Kill 45 U.A.E. Soldiers in Yemen Fighting
headline.print_headline: 45 Soldiers From U.A.E. Are Killed in Yemen
